title: ABCD² Score for TIA
description: Estimates stroke risk after a transient ischemic attack (TIA), based on patient risk factors

ranges.interpretation: Stroke risk in 2 days: 1.0%; in 7 days: 1.2%; in 90 days: 3.1%. Can be managed outpatient with scheduled diagnostic evaluation.
Stroke risk in 2 days: 4.1%; in 7 days: 5.9%; in 90 days: 9.8%. Consider hospitalization for urgent investigation and initiation of preventive measures.
Stroke risk in 2 days: 8.1%; in 7 days: 11.7%; in 90 days: 17.8%. Urgent hospitalization recommended for investigation and immediate initiation of preventive measures.

references: Johnston SC, Rothwell PM, Nguyen-Huynh MN, et al. Validation and refinement of scores to predict very early stroke risk after transient ischaemic attack. Lancet. 2007;369(9558):283-92.
Rothwell PM, Giles MF, Flossmann E, et al. A simple score (ABCD) to identify individuals at high early risk of stroke after transient ischaemic attack. Lancet. 2005;366(9479):29-36.
formula: A (Age ≥60) + B (BP ≥140/90) + C (Clinical features) + D (Duration) + D (Diabetes)
notes: Validated for patients with TIA within 7 days of the event
Unilateral weakness is 2 points, isolated speech disturbance is 1 point
Not applicable for patients with established stroke
